dt: {bc}a religious discourse delivered in public usually by a member of the clergy as a part of a worship service

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}sermun{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}sermon-, sermo{/it}, from Latin, speech, conversation, from {it}serere{/it} to link together {ma}{mat|series|}{/ma}
shortdef: a religious discourse delivered in public usually by a member of the clergy as a part of a worship service
a speech on conduct or duty

dt: {bc}an ethical discourse delivered by Jesus and recorded in Matthew 5–7 and paralleled briefly in Luke 6:20–49

shortdef: an ethical discourse delivered by Jesus and recorded in Matthew 5—7 and paralleled briefly in Luke 6:20—49
